abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the First Nuestras Raices
            Project for Honduras were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory; the risk to development outcome
            was high; the Bank's performance was moderately
            satisfactory; and the Borrower's performance was also
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            Social assessments are critical not only to identify
            appropriate cultural practices but also to consider the
            political economy of project design at every phase for every
            stakeholder in the process; appropriate monitoring
            arrangements are needed from the outset of project
            implementation to improve management effectiveness; periodic
            implementation and process evaluations both during start-up
            and during implementation are recommended; the bank should
            consider adding a. staffing clause to future operations; and
            a project's risk analysis should include an assessment
            of the impact of all risks materializing during implementation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Nuestras Raices
            Project is that indigenous and Afro-Honduran groups have
            increased participation in the holistic development
            processes of their communities and their nation. The only
            change is adding to the items to be financed out of the
            proceeds of the credit under the category three of
            disbursement the 'operating costs for the supervision
            of sub-projects'. 'Operating costs' means the
            incremental expenses incurred on account of sub-projects
            implementation, including office equipment and supplies,
            vehicle operation and maintenance, communication and
            insurance costs, office administration costs, utilities,
            travel, per diem and supervision costs of locally contracted
            employees. In addition to the new definition, it is
            important to highlight that the Amendment is retroactive as
            of the effectiveness date of the credit agreement, and that
            the disbursement table is amended to include operating costs
            under category (three). This change responds to government
            request to cover part of the operating costs associated with
            the supervision of the sub-projects given the fiscal
            constraints consequence of the economic crisis that reduced
            the budgetary revenues.

repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Nuestras Raices Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Honduras Nuestras Raices Project, which increases the
            participation of indigenous populations and ethnic blacks in
            the development process, and strengthens technical and
            financial management of community micro-projects and ethnic
            organizations. This report outlines pertinent environmental
            regulations and laws, assesses expected impacts and proposes
            mitigations while identifying the communities' role,
            and incorporates these risks into project planning, and
            monitoring and evaluation. Planning will address at minimum,
            defining the operation and maintenance of water supply
            systems, and the treatment and disposal of solid waste;
            reforestation; the role of the community; and coordination
            with municipal plans. Potential environmental risks also
            include impacts/hazards due to demolition, fire, and
            flooding; construction and use of temporary latrines for
            workers; water contamination and sedimentation; occupational
            health and safety concerns, such as the availability of
            protective gear and signage for danger zones; and the
            emission of particulates, dust, and gases.

docna.cdata!:
Honduras - Nuestras Raices Project :
            environmental assessment

display_title.display_title:
Honduras - Proyecto Nuestras
            Raíces: Evaluación ambiental

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Nuestras Raices
            Project is that indigenous and Afro-Honduran groups have
            increased participation in the integrated development
            processes of their communities and their nation. This
            objective will be achieved by strengthening the
            communities' local capacity to build sustainable
            organizations, development projects and cultural identity.
            To this end, the project will actively promote interaction
            between the ethnic communities, local governments and
            central government agencies and programs. During the
            three-year project, Nuestras Raices will seek to strengthen
            the participation and influence of Honduras' ethnic
            groups in local development processes. The project has three
            components. Component 1 supports a process of participatory
            development planning among the indigenous and Afro-Honduran
            communities and the federations in order to: (a) train and
            prepare ethnic communities and their ethnic representations
            to actively participate in the local development planning
            process; (b) identify subprojects to be financed under
            Nuestras Raices and other programs; and (c) encourage ethnic
            federations to work more closely with municipalities to
            leverage funds. Component 2 allocates grants for
            subprojects. Component 3  finances capacity building of
            ethnic communities to lead their own development process,
            institutional strengthening of the Nuestras Raices team,
            located within al Fondo Hondureno de Inversion Social
            (FHIS), and monitoring and evaluation. The main capacity
            building activities include training and technical
            assistance to the communities in participatory development
            planning, project identification, planning, execution,
            operation and maintenance, and funds and materials management.
